articles.author: Sean Moran
articles.title: Kevin Cramer Defeats Heidi Heitkamp in North Dakota Senate Race
articles.description: Rep. Kevin Cramer (R-ND) defeated Sen. Heidi Heitkamp (D-ND) in the North Dakota Senate race on Tuesday, serving as a rebuke to one of the nation’s most vulnerable red-state Democrats, according to Fox News.
articles.content: “Thank you North Dakota. Representing you in the United States Senate will be the honor of a lifetime,” Cramer wrote in a tweet on Tuesday night. Thank you North Dakota. Representing you in the United States Senate will be the honor of a lifetime. pic.twitter… [+3792 chars]

articles.author: Joel B. Pollak
articles.title: Critics Question Fox News Calling House for Democrats with California Polls Still Open
articles.description: Fox News called the U.S. House of Representatives for the Democrats on Tuesday night just after 9:30 p.m. EST -- with polls still open in California for nearly an hour and a half.
articles.content: BREAKING: The Fox News Decision Desk projects that Democrats will take control of the House of Representatives for the first time in eight years. https://t.co/4yNg8n30sj pic.twitter.com/kA8joAhvti Fox News (@FoxNews) November 7, 2018 No other network followed… [+1497 chars]

articles.author: Kristina Wong
articles.title: GOP Henry McMaster Wins Re-Election as South Carolina Governor
articles.description: Republican South Carolina Governor Henry McMaster won his reelection race Tuesday evening, defeating a challenge from Democrat James Smith.
articles.content: The Associated Press called the race for McMaster at 9:33 p.m. EST. McMaster served as South Carolina’s lieutenant governor and became governor in 2017 after then-Gov. Nikki Haley was tapped by President Trump to become the U.S. Ambassador to the United Natio… [+47 chars]

articles.author: Justin Caruso
articles.title: Taylor Swift Fails to Take Out Marsha Blackburn
articles.description: Pop superstar Taylor Swift’s endorsement of Democratic Senate candidate Phil Bredesen failed to persuade the great people of Tennessee on Tuesday. The race was called for Tennessee Republican Rep. Marsha Blackburn (R-TN-07) at around 8:05 pm. She handily defe…
articles.content: The race was called for Tennessee Republican Rep. Marsha Blackburn (R-TN-07) at around 8:05 pm. She handily defeated her Democratic opponent, former Gov. Phil Bredesen, whom Swift gave a full-throated endorsement. The 28-year-old singer broke longtime silence… [+4187 chars]

articles.author: Sean Moran
articles.title: Joe Manchin Beats Patrick Morrisey in West Virginia Senate Race
articles.description: Sen. Joe Manchin (D-WV) won the West Virginia Senate race on Tuesday, beating West Virginia Attorney General and Republican candidate Patrick Morrisey.
articles.content: Sen. Manchin won the West Virginia Senate race on Tuesday, besting Senate Republican candidate Morrisey. Manchin faced a competitive Senate race against Morrisey in a state that President Donald Trump won by more than 40 points during the 2016 presidential el… [+1752 chars]

articles.author: Sean Moran
articles.title: Republican Denver Riggleman Beats Leslie Cockburn in Virginia’s 5th District
articles.description: Republican Denver Riggleman is projected to beat Democrat Leslie Cockburn to replace the outgoing Rep. Tom Garrett (R-VA).
articles.content: Riggleman’s victory on Tuesday serves as a strong victory for conservatives. Rep. Garrett announced earlier this year that he will retire. During the district’s Republican nomination process, Riggleman told Breitbart News that he hopes to join the conservativ… [+995 chars]

articles.author: Kristina Wong
articles.title: Republican Andy Barr Defeats Democrat Amy McGrath in Close Kentucky House Race
articles.description: Republican incumbent Kentucky Rep. Andy Barr defeated his Democrat challenger Amy McGrath Tuesday night in a close race for his House seat.
articles.content: The fight for Kentucky’s Sixth Congressional District was extraordinarily close at times, at one point showing McGrath ahead by 20 votes. However, Barr was able to pull ahead as more votes started coming in. The race was rated as a “toss up” by RealClearPolit… [+335 chars]

articles.author: Sean Moran
articles.title: Mike Braun Trumps Joe Donnelly in Indiana Senate Race
articles.description: Hoosier businessman Mike Braun defeated Sen. Joe Donnelly (D-IN) in the competitive Indiana Senate race, serving a sharp rebuke to the political establishment and one of the Senate's most vulnerable Democrats.
articles.content: Braun defeated the incumbent Senate Democrat in the heated Indiana Senate race. Braun cast himself as a political outsider during the Indiana Republican Senate primary and touted his business experience, noting the similarities between himself and President D… [+3050 chars]

articles.description: Join Breitbart News and SiriusXM Patriot Tuesday night for a special Election Night 2018 live stream.

articles.author: Robert Kraychik
articles.title: Andrew GiIlum’s Press Tent Leaks During Downpour
articles.description: Sections of the Andrew Gillum campaign's outdoor press tent in Tallahassee, FL, had to be cut to prevent collapse under Tuesday's heavy rains. Various reporters on scene shared videos and photos from within the tent.
articles.content: CTV’s Richard Madan shared on Twitter from inside, wondering why Gillum’s election night party was not held indoors. What a mess. Security evacuating @AndrewGillum sagging press tent because of the torrential downpour. Cables and electrical wires are on soaki… [+2376 chars]

articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.title: Democrat Donna Shalala Beats GOP Rep. Maria Elvira Salazar in Florida
articles.description: Democrat Donna Shalala is projected to defeat Rep. Maria Elvira Salazar (R-FL), turning Florida's 27th congressional district blue.

articles.author: Joshua Caplan
articles.title: Democrat Jennifer Wexton Defeats GOP’s Barbara Comstock in Virginia
articles.description: Democrat Jennifer Wexton is projected to defeat Rep. Barbara Comstock (R-VA) in Virginia's 10th congressional district, according to NBC News.
articles.content: Wexton, a state senator, is ahead of Comstock 57.9 percent to 42.1 percent with 56 percent of the votes counted.

articles.author: Frances Martel
articles.title: China Blames Copyright Issues for Ban on 6,000 Songs in Karaoke Bars
articles.description: The Chinese Communist Party regulatory body that controls the nation's karaoke venues announced a ban on 6,000 songs this week, claiming the Chinese businesses were not paying the original artists for their work.
articles.content: The songs banned include some of China’s most popular, causing controversy on the Chinese social network Weibo, including songs by artists in Taiwan and Hong Kong, whose young people have become increasingly vocal in their quest for self-governance. China wil… [+4112 chars]

articles.author: Nate Church
articles.title: FCC Chairman Ajit Pai Takes Aim at the ‘Robocall’ Epidemic
articles.description: U.S. Federal Communications Commission (FCC) Chairman Ajit Pai took aim at telecommunications companies on Monday, demanding action to thwart excessive automated phone calls.
articles.content: Pai is following up on an FCC letter sent to 13 companies in May, asking them to develop a “call authentication system” to prevent the use of “spoof” numbers used by spammers. This latest letter asks for an answer as to what the companies are doing to meet th… [+1165 chars]
